snippet: Some saw empty busts in the windows of West 47th Street shops closed for the High Holy Days, but the photographer Daniel Terna saw regal sculptures that were “more beautiful” than when they were draped with necklaces.
abstract: Photographer Daniel Terna captures images of unadorned velvet jewelry busts in Manhattan store fronts.
lead_paragraph: Some saw empty busts in the windows of West 47th Street shops closed for the High Holy Days, but the photographer Daniel Terna saw regal sculptures that were “more beautiful” than when they were draped with necklaces.

headline.print_headline: The Case of the Missing Jewels
headline.main: When the Jewels Are Unseen in the Diamond District, but Beauty Remains
